snippet: Illinois was hit especially hard by tornadoes that tore through the Midwest on Sunday, killing at least six people and leaving hundreds of thousands without power.
abstract: Tornado that ripped through Midwest was especially devastating in Illinois, where at least six are dead and hundreds of thousands remain without power; officials estimate that 500 homes were destroyed in city of Washington, which has only 1,500 residents.

byline.original: By STEVEN YACCINO and JOHN SCHWARTZ
byline.contributor: Steven Yaccino reported from Washington, Ill., and John Schwartz from New York. Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Illinois was hit especially hard by tornadoes that tore through the Midwest on Sunday, killing at least six people and leaving hundreds of thousands without power.

headline.main: Power Still Out for Thousands After Tornadoes Pound Midwest
headline.print_headline: Power Still Out For Thousands After Tornadoes Pound Midwest
